Getting Started

This styleguide is used to define elements and styles for the ____ brand.

Grids and columns can be created using existing Foundation classes. Please refer to their documentation for examples and usage instructions.

Jekyll is used to reuse duplicated HTML. Use jekyll serve to generate outputted site to the _site directory.

To compile Sass, cd to the assets directory then use gulp watch.

Directory Structure

Sass is used for this project to create modular code that is sustainable and reusable. The Sass follows Atomic Design principles. The directory structure is designed around this concept.

Inside the Sass folder you will find style.scss. This file is responsible for importing all the necessary styles. Open up this file and recompile the compressed css if you find some components are not necessary.

The variables folder contains variables to setup the project. All files are prefixed with v-.

The framework folder contains outside code that has be repurposed for this project. These include css frameworks, font libraries and other css plugins.

The mixins folder contains mixins that are used throughout the Sass folder. All files are prefixed with mx-.

The general folder contains styles that are applied directly to bare html elements.

The classes folder contains classes used to modify and style elements by adding classes. All files are prefixed with c-.

The atoms folder contains styles used to create single elements such as buttons. All files are prefixed with a-.

The molecules folder contains styles used to create components with multiple elements such as a sidebar navigation. All files are prefixed with ml-.

Optimizations

In order to optimize the final outputted css all unused code should be commented out in the style.scss file.

Icon libraries that are used can significantly increase the final file size. It is important to only include the specific icons used.

Content Structure

Use the following elements to structure content. main,article,section

The main. element should contain the main content for your web page. All of this content should be unique to the individual page, and should not appear elsewhere on the site.

The article element should contain a piece of self-contained content that could be distributed outside the context of the page. This includes things like news articles, blog posts, or user comments.

The section element should contain related content. Think of it like this... the article element is a news article, and the section is a section inside that article.

Branding

Logos

Please use the required white space of at least 1/4 of the "A" height. Alternatively 3/8 whitespace is required when logomark is inside a circular inclosure.

Logomark

Logotype

Colors

Background colors can be used on any element using .color-bg-[color]. The class .color-bg-none can be used to remove background colors.

primary

midnight
calm
cream

success
warning
dark
light

Basic Text Elements

Headers

Headers are sized and balanced using a modular scale. Additionally sublines can be added by using .opacity classes and .text-weight classes. Headers are created by using h1 through h6

H1 Header subline

H2 Header subline

H3 Header subline

H4 Header subline

H5 Header subline
H6 Header subline

Paragraphs

Paragraphs come standard with a preset line-height and font size. Size was determined based on viewing distance of the user. p

Quotes

Blockquotes are used to display commentary by other people.
blockquote

Here we can display a blockquote Google.com

Pre

Pre formatted text can be used when you want to preserve the white space
pre 

This is pre formated text to display
               on the screen.

Links

Links are pretty self explanatory.
a

Here is a link.

Lists

By default lists can be numbered or simply plain bullet points. Use ui for an unordered list and ol for a ordered list. A class of list-none can be added to remove any bullet points.

  • Item one
  • Item two
  • Item three
  1. Item one
  2. Item two
  3. Item three
  1. Item one
  2. Item two
  3. Item three

Tables

Use tables to display data. Tables can be styled in a number of ways, use this example as a starting point.

Item Price Quantity Total

T-shirt

100% cotton

 $35.00 4 $140

T-shirt

100% cotton

 $35.00 5 $175
Total 9 $315

Defintion Lists

A definition list dl is used to display name-value pairs, like metadata or a dictionary definition. Each term dt is paired with one or more definitions dd.

Time
The indefinite continued progress of existence and events in the past, present, and future regarded as a whole.
Space
A continuous area or expanse that is free, available, or unoccupied.
The dimensions of height, depth, and width within which all things exist and move.

Abbreviations

Use the abbr tag to annotate a shortened term. Abbreviations must always have a title attribute which clarifies the full term.

In my dream last night, I saw J. R. R. Tolkien and George R. R. Martin hanging out on Sunset Blvd

Keystrokes

Use the kbd element to annotate a key stroke or combination.

Press Cmd+Q (or Ctrl+Q on Windows) to play Half-Life 3.

Basic Form Elements

Sample Form

The form to the side includes all the basic elements of a form. Use .input-alert to highlight fields that need the users attention.

Personal information:

Masking Form Inputs

Input elements can include a masks to guide users in the right direction. The jQuery Mask Plugin is used for this. JQuery and the jquery.mask.min.js files are required.
$( document ).ready(function() { $('.mask-date').mask('00/00/0000'); $('.mask-phonenumber').mask('(000) 000-0000'); });

Personal information:

Text Helper Classes

Alignment

By default text is aligned to the left. Use .text-[direction] to change this on any element.

.text-right

Additonal classes can be used to resize paragraphs and other elements. Use .text-[size] to change this on any element.

Text Color

Change color of text using the following classes. Use .text-[color] to change text color on any element. Addtionally .text-invert can be added to any dark container to invert all the child text elements.

.text-primary

.text-navy

.text-midnight

.text-calm

.text-cream

.text-alert

.text-success

.text-warning

.text-dark

.text-light

Header

Use .text-invert on dark containers to change text colour.

Letter Spacing

Use these classes to add letter spacing to text. Use .text-letterspacing-[x] to change this on any element.

.text-letterspacing-1

.text-letterspacing-2

.text-letterspacing-3

Text Weight

Use these classes to change the text weight. Use .text-weight-[xxx] to change this on any element.

.text-weight-100

.text-weight-200

.text-weight-300

.text-weight-400

.text-weight-500

.text-weight-600

.text-weight-700

.text-weight-800

.text-weight-900

Text Decoration

Use these classes to change the text decoration.

.text-decoration-none

text-decoration-strike

text-decoration-underline

Text Transform

Use these classes to transform text.

.text-transform-uppercase

Font Family

Use these classes to change the font family to match headers or body text.

.text-family-header

.text-family-default

Label

Use .label class to emphasize and highlight text with a background

.label

Tooltips

Applying an attribute of data-tooltip to any element will add a tooltip when hovered.

Hover over me

Buttons

.button .button-small

Buttons must be assigned a background color and text color using classes. Unless using a form buttons are created using an a tag.

.button .color-bg-primary

regular

.button-small .color-bg-primary

small

.button-small .full .color-bg-primary .text-center

full width

Utility

Borders

Use these classes to apply borders to any element. Addtionally .border-color-[color] can be used to change the border color to any color in the pallete. The class .border-none can be used to remove borders.

Borders can be applied using the following classes:
.border-solid
.border-dashed
.border-dotted
.border-solid-top
.border-solid-right
.border-solid-bottom
.border-solid-left
.border-solid .border-color-alert

Opacity

Use opacity classes from .opacity-0 to .opacity-4 to adjust transparency. Additionaly .opacity-full can be used to set a opacity level of 100%.

Change opacity using the following classes
.opacity-0 .opacity-1 .opacity-2 .opacity-3 .opacity-4 .opacity-full

Center

Use .center-block to center block elements with definded widths.

Center

Visibility

Classes to hide or show content for different devices. (Resize browser to demo)

.mobile-only

.tablet-up

.desktop-only

Display

The following classes are available to change the display of any element; .display-none,.display-inline,.display-block,.display-initial,.display-print-none

.display-none .display-inline .display-block .display-initial .display-print-none

Position

The following classes are available to change the display of any element; .position-fixed,.position-absolute,.position-relative,.position-static

.position-fixed
.position-absolute
.position-relative
.position-static

Overflow

Use .overflow-hidden or .overflow-ellipsis to change the overflow of an element.

.overflow-hidden

.overflow-ellipsis

Shadows

Use .shadow-bottom to apply a shadow to the bottom of any element.

Cursor

Use .cursor-pointer to change the cursor when hovering over an element.

Z Index

Use these classes to change the z-index.

.zindex-n10

.zindex-n1

.zindex-1

.zindex-10

.zindex-100

.zindex-1000

Rounded Corners

It's easy to apply rounded corners to anything by using .rounded. Use .circular on square shapes to create circles. Rounded corners can be removed by using .unround

.rounded

Margin

There are a number of classes used for applying and removing margins. All rangeing in 7 levels.

.margin-05
.margin-1
.margin-2
.margin-3
.margin-4
.margin-5
.margin-6
.margin-t1
.margin-b1
.margin-tb1
.margin-lr1
.margin-none
.margin-none-t
.margin-none-b
.margin-none-l
.margin-none-r

Padding

There are a number of classes used for applying and removing paddings. All rangeing in 7 levels.

.padding-05
.padding-1
.padding-2
.padding-3
.padding-4
.padding-5
.padding-6
.padding-t1
.padding-b1
.padding-tb1
.padding-lr1
.padding-none
.padding-none-t
.padding-none-b
.padding-none-l
.padding-none-r

Float

It's easy to float elements.

.float-left .float-right

Width

full

Apply this class to force a 100% width element

.full
